channel.title: NYC Mosque
channel.description:
For the people who are unaware (foreigners mostly), a Muslim mosque is being constructed near Ground Zero, site of the 9/11 terorist attacks. It is being supported by Mayor Bloomberg and President Obama, citing freedom of religion. There have been mixed reports of the Mosque opening on 9/11/11.
Now, I have no problem with the mosque itself. Islam as a whole was not the cause of the attacks, and it's a shame the actions of a small group of extremists automatically made all Muslims evil terrorists in the eyes of the American majority. They have every right to place their mosque anywhere they want. Yes, the area is sensitive. Living half-an-hour from the city, I know firsthand the tension in the area that still stands because of the events of that fateful day. But sensitivity cannot overpower the basic rights guaranteed by the US, no matter the tragedy.
That being said, if the rumors are confirmed and the opening day IS on 9/11/11, that's just blatantly and purposefully offensive. If that's the case, I certainly take issue with it, but it is unconfirmed at this point, so I will hold my tongue.
What say you?

item.title: NYC Mosque
item.dc:creator: Secomed
item.description:
I put “Hate” in quotations because i thought that hate was a strong word. And really I cant speak for all Muslims and all Americans, im sure that not all Muslims “Hate” america, and im sure that not all Americans “hate” Muslims. But unforchanetly I live in a country of bigoted republicans that think the whole middle east are a bunch of scumbags

P.S sorry for bumping this thread, didnt notice that this thread was old.

item.title: NYC Mosque
item.dc:creator: Soup
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Cite a source first.

The best I can find is this, which says that actually the entire building is a mosque because part is used for worship (it says nothing about the exclusive use).

When you disagreed, you didn’t cite anything.

Also, go look through this thread if you want citations. I’ve already said it’d been posted before.
